headline: Wall Street’s New Trade Is Dumping Any Stock in AI’s Crosshairs
summary: The latest selloff erupted on Tuesday when a tax-strategy tool rolled out by a little-known startup, Altruist Corp., sent shares of Charles Schwab Corp., Raymond James Financial Inc. and LPL Financial Holdings Inc. down by 7% or more.  “Every company with any sort of potential disruption risk is getting sold indiscriminately,” said John Belton, a money manager at Gabelli Funds.  The advances in AI have been at the forefront of Wall Street over the past few years, with tech stocks leading the charge.

headline: Why The Narrative Around Business First Bancshares (BFST) Is Shifting After Deals And New Targets
summary: Business First Bancshares’ fair value estimate has shifted modestly, with the target moving from US$32.70 to US$32.88 as recent research updates cluster around higher views on the stock. This small change reflects how analysts are weighing the potential earnings contribution from the Oakwood and Progressive deals against the integration and balance sheet risks that more cautious voices are flagging. Stay with this article to see how you can keep on top of these evolving research calls and the...

headline: Why The Story Around DigitalBridge Group (DBRG) Is Shifting After SoftBank Bid And Analyst Downgrade
summary: DigitalBridge Group's latest update keeps the fair value estimate anchored at US$16.00 per share, even as the discount rate and revenue growth inputs are adjusted around the edges. Bullish and bearish analysts are reading that steady headline target very differently, with one side seeing renewed confidence in the digital infrastructure story and the other focusing on the execution risk implied by the changes. As you read on, keep an eye on how these small shifts can reshape the bigger...
